etymologies: late Middle English: alteration of obsolete scrow ‘roll’, shortening of escrow

definitions: a roll of parchment or paper for writing or painting on.
shortDefinitions: roll of parchment or paper for writing on

definitions: an ancient book or document written on a scroll.
shortDefinitions: ancient book or document written on scroll

definitions: an ornamental design or carving resembling a partly unrolled scroll of parchment, e.g. on the capital of a column, or at the end of a stringed instrument.
shortDefinitions: ornamental design or carving resembling partly unrolled scroll of parchment

definitions: a depiction of a narrow ribbon bearing a motto or inscription.
shortDefinitions: depiction of narrow ribbon bearing motto or inscription

definitions: the facility which moves a display on a computer screen in order to view new material

examples.text: if scroll is enabled, the window scrolls down

shortDefinitions: facility which moves display on computer screen

definitions: move displayed text or graphics in a particular direction on a computer screen in order to view different parts of them
shortDefinitions: move displayed text or graphics in particular direction on computer screen

definitions: (of displayed text or graphics) move up, down, or across a computer screen

examples.text: the words of the story begin scrolling up the screen

shortDefinitions: (of displayed text or graphics) move up, down, or across computer screen

definitions: cause to move like paper rolling or unrolling

examples.text: the wind scrolled back the uppermost layer of loose dust

shortDefinitions: cause to move like paper rolling or unrolling
